questions.question: Which of the following algorithms is used for unsupervised learning?
What does the term 'bias-variance tradeoff' refer to?

options.A: The balance between training and testing data
options.B: The tradeoff between model complexity and performance
options.C: The balance between bias and variance in model predictions
options.D: The tradeoff between feature selection and feature scaling

questions.question: Which of the following is a commonly used algorithm for regression tasks?
Which method is used to combine multiple models to improve performance?
Which type of neural network is primarily used for image recognition tasks?
What is the primary goal of 'reinforcement learning from human feedback' in machine learning?

options.B: Training a model with high computational cost
options.C: Rewarding agents based on their exploration

questions.question: In generative adversarial networks (GANs), what is the primary role of the 'discriminator' network?

options.C: Evaluating the quality of generated data

questions.question: What is the main challenge of 'fairness-aware machine learning'?

options.B: Ensuring that machine learning models are fair and unbiased
options.D: Balancing the trade-off between precision and recall

questions.question: In reinforcement learning, what does the term 'off-policy' mean?

options.B: Learning from the agent's own experiences
options.C: Evaluating the policy while following a different policy
options.D: Learning from a fixed set of labeled data

questions.question: What does 'model interpretability' refer to in machine learning?

options.A: The ability to explain the inner workings of a model
options.B: The computational cost of training a model
options.C: The capacity of a model to generalize to unseen data
options.D: The size of the model's training dataset

questions.question: In the context of reinforcement learning, what is the 'reward shaping' technique used for?

options.A: Accelerating the convergence of the agent
options.C: Assigning rewards to states and actions

questions.question: What is the primary goal of 'domain adaptation' in machine learning?

options.A: Transferring knowledge from one domain to another

questions.question: In text generation, what is the 'GPT-3' model known for?
Which technique is commonly used for 'transfer learning' in computer vision, allowing pre-trained models to be fine-tuned for specific tasks?
What is the primary purpose of the 'ResNet' architecture in deep learning?

options.A: Reducing the complexity of neural networks

questions.question: In reinforcement learning, what is the 'Actor-Critic' architecture used for?

options.C: Combining value estimation and policy optimization

questions.question: What does the term 'universality' refer to in machine learning?

options.A: The ability of a model to generalize across various domains
options.B: The capability of a model to learn without labeled data
options.C: The reduction of dimensionality in feature engineering
options.D: The capacity of a model to interpolate between data points

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for 'link prediction' in network analysis, such as predicting connections between users in a social network?
What is the primary challenge of 'explanation-based machine learning'?

options.B: Reducing the computational cost of model training

questions.question: In 'zero-shot learning,' what does the term 'unseen classes' refer to?

options.B: Classes that have already been seen during training
options.D: Classes that were not part of the training set
